specJson.name: brightics.function.timeseries.timeseries_decomposition$timeseries_decomposition
specJson.label: Time Series Decomposition
specJson.description:
Decomposes a time series data into trend, seasonal and residual. The function gives graphs of observed, trend, seasonal, and residual. This function does seasonal decomposition using moving averages.

Reference

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decomposition_of_time_series

params.label: Input Column
params.description: Choose the column of the time series data to analyze. The input data in the chosen column should be of number type(Double, Long, Integer).

params.label: Frequency
params.description: Frequency of the series. Must be used if x is not a pandas object. Overrides default periodicity of x if x is a pandas object with a time series index.

params.label: Model Type
params.description: Choose the type of the variance of the data. If the standard deviation is propertional to the mean size of the data, choose 'Multiplicative'. (default = 'Additive')

params.label: Filteration
params.description: The filter coefficients for filtering out the seasonal component. The concrete moving average method used in filtering is determined by two_sided.

params.label: Two-Sided
params.description: The moving average method used in filtering. If True (default), a centered moving average is computed using the filteration. If False, the filter coefficients are for past values only.

params.label: Extrapolate Trend
params.description: If set to > 0, the trend resulting from the convolution is linear least-squares extrapolated on both ends (or the single one if two_sided is False) considering this many (+1) closest points. If set to �쁣req��, use freq closest points. Setting this parameter results in no NaN values in trend or residual components.
